title: Riot help me I dont want to get banned again
body:
Toa of light
Hello recently I heve been ban for being toxic I accept the ban but I dont want to get banned again. So I wanted to know what a person can do to not flame. In my case I dont like to lose rank because of other player and but if they try to win and we lose its ok I only get really mad when they troll on ranked games. To summurise what can i do when I get a troller in my ranked game ( dodgin is not an option cause they i get banned to ). Ive tryed mute but that only helps a bit but u still lose the game and get deranked because of other peoples faul. Cause now in this "new" lol its impossible to cary alone so even if Im good i cant win if we got a troll. SO RITO PLS HELP ME WHAN CAN I DO WHEN I GET A TROLL :*

Grettings from a sumuner from EUW :D

replies.body: I would recommend simply enduring it. If you need some stress relief I hear that raging out loud at the screen instead of through the chat works for some people. Bear in mind that your opponents probably get a troll too every few games. The roughest part is when people emote spam you for losing when you know they know it wasn't your fault for losing, but if you just endure it you will climb to your appropriate rank in time.

Personally, I rage outloud rather than in chat, when I do.
If someone annoys me, I mute them.
You can try typing out your messages in chat, but don't press enter, just press esc and keep playing if that helps.

Also, Dodging in champion select won't get you banned fam. You'll get a dodge timer, but you won't suffer any account penalties, other than -3 LP. But taking the -3 LP is better than taking a full loss, is it not?

ps, Nice Name :P
Swear outlouds. Works for me

/mute all

that said, you can always make a lot of accounts and do pre-emptive trolling in anticipation of people trolling you. that would be the logical path to having fun at other players' expense

Tips from an NA Silver Jungler (a.k.a. the first target of flaming): 

If someone is flaming you or anyone else on your team, mute them. Something I do is I tell my team to mute the player as well to help me and my team avoid tilt. 

Try to avoid typing in chat. I find I tilt less when I type less. So don't use chat unless you need to communicate something more complex that's important, like telling your team to push waves then take baron, or to prep an objective before it comes up. 

USE PINGS NOT YOUR KEYBOARD.

If someone is just complaining in chat, mute them, it can and will put you on tilt.

Do NOT send even one even slightly sarcastic or flamey message in chat. If you do it once, you will do it more. 

Think about how to win the game and focus less on individual players. Playing support and your ADC is a lost cause (gets caught out of position constantly despite warnings, takes dumb fights repeatedly)? Roam, do not go back to lane, invest resources into deep warding the enemy jungle and ganking other lanes. Keep in mind everyone makes mistakes once or twice and that doesn't mean you should just give up, it's just when they don't learn. Mid/Top and your jungler won't gank? Roam/TP gank if you can't win your lane. Keep in mind there are lanes your jungler will have trouble ganking, and if you want a gank, let them push and freeze the wave near your tower. ADC and your support keeps getting caught? Simply ask them to stand behind you, just let them push and let you you farm so you can scale. Jungler and you're behind? Play around a strong/winning lane. When your laner is pushed tower, in most situations your laners will get to you faster than theirs if you find/fight the other jungler. Use this safety to get wards into their jungle and when they gank the opposite side of the map you're on, invade their jungle/set up vision. You can also just farm it out if the champion allows it.

What I try to do is see the best in the match. Is one person a troll? Eh. Whatever. Find the nice guy. Find the guy you can joke with. Even if he's on the enemy team. Find the friendly guy, there's always one.

I find it helps to start talking immediately. I always enter the lobby with "Heya! :3", and keep conversing as long as I'm able. Joke, laugh, find something funny. Try to make light of your mistakes. Even if there is that asshole that's like "you talk too much", just ignore him.

Try to keep criticism in a friendly manner. If you can't do that, just don't criticize at all. This isn't just to keep you from being punished, it's to try to keep your team from getting tilted.

And always try to shift blame away from your teammates however you can. If someone messes up, remind them that even pros make mistakes. Try to shift the fault of someone doing bad to it being a "bad matchup" or whatever. Just try to keep everyone happy. It's the only way to make it through.

Finally, try to vent your frustration a little bit at a time. Redirect it to something that won't be hurt by it, let it out in small bursts of exasperation (NOT directed at your teammates!), or find a way to utilize it. If you can't do that, then just hold it in and let it out at the end of the match.

To be honest there is nothing you can do. Riot unfortunately does not take trolls or intentional feeders seriously.  Not saying toxicity is ok, but its typically fueled by something worse, which is inting. The amount of players I have had straight up walk down mid lane and go 0-12 is appalling. And yes, I am guilty of being toxic in those situations. I report these players, follow their accounts and yet Riot never bans them.  So to me, Riot is saying, its not ok to be toxic but its totally acceptable to intentionally feed. They are sending the message that its ok to waste 4 peoples time, that in life its ok to Intentionally lose, and its ok to have a negative attitude. Furthermore, riot is FORCING us to accept intentionally feeding without saying a word, for fear of being banned by big bad riot. Riot themselves fail to understand why most people are toxic.. I think it would be beneficial for them to go through chat logs and see that the majority of people are toxic because they are in a game with someone that is inting. I think this is riots major flaw. I am sorry riot, but you will never stop flaming if you don't stop intentional feeders. I would love to hear from someone in riot that can explain to me why intentional feeding is never punished but toxicity is? I would love to hear their rational as to why its ok to Int, but its not ok to get upset at someone for inting and wasting 30+ minutes of your time? 

Riot should stop their double standard and realize that inting and toxicity are hand in hand and intimately related. Its not like the majority of us rage on people for having a bad game

I feel that toxicity and inting/trolling should be switched in place. Like inting and trolling is DIRECTLY affecting the game, making the enemies stronger, meanwhile just flaming or being toxic can easily be dealt with by muting. Obviously inting and trolling is the much bigger problem here, and people should be punished for inting/trolling without getting away with it. And toxicity shouldn't be bannable, its in every game, part of every game. Everyone rages at one point or another, i can understand chat restrictions, but getting perma banned or suspended for "TALKING" is over the top imo. 

tl;dr Inting/trolling should be top priority for Rito to be punishing people, toxicity should be dealt with only chat restrictions and honor reward restrictions. Banned for typing in chat is over exaggerated punishment IMO, meanwhile trolling/inting should DEFINITELY BE PUNISHED BY BANNING since it PHYSICALLY and DIRECTLY affects how the game goes. It's literally being toxic IN ACTION..

you know the saying "Action over words" or something.. its like that, flaming and being toxic is like. 'Yeah whatever' *MUTE* but inting/trolling... you cant just 'Yeah whatever' that. you can't just MUTE that or something, its ACTION it is literally ruining the game, helping the enemy team and ALSO tilting everyone else. So much worse than just words.

It honestly depends on the many factors that are in play, like what your role, champion, and team composition.
I don't think is needed for a twitch or kog'maw to talk or even communicate with the team other then with pings as most, but roles like
support or jungle will need communications with the rest of the team to gain a higher chance at victory.

As someone who mained support and sometimes do mute all, I have never felt hindered but mute all.  I can still effectively communicate what I'm doing or need in pings without chatting or with super minimal chat dialog.

As someone who has been chat restricted about 2-3 times since i started playing back in season 2, I find the best way to not be toxic is to either mute the enemy team, or just disable all chat altogether.
Most player use all chat to flame, and if the enemy uses all chat is usually to trash talk and try to tilt you so by removing this element alone can help improve not only your gameplay but also your attitude towards your team.
DO NOT /mute all or tell someone you're muting them because then they're more likely to abuse pings, muting pings should be the last resort to dealing with a toxic player.

Good on you for making the effort. Personally, I find listening to my own music helps set a more enjoyable mood. I've heard some people say they will simply remove the enter key from the keyboard so they won't say something they regret.

For me, reminding myself "It's just a game. I should be having fun." helps the most. Just putting things in perspective. If that doesn't help you can take a break: play some aram, watch one of your replays, do something productive for a bit, etc.

Good luck!

Riots banning system sucks.  It just makes the game more toxic as a mistake is immediately followed by threats of reports and the majority of toxic play doesn't fit into reporting categories, only toxic speech allowing more and more trolls to ruin ranked games while the players trying to play are getting reports and chat-restrictions/bans.  The more Riot pretends to improve their system to make the game less toxic, the more their system feeds the toxicity and makes it worse.  Beta this game wasn't toxic, it was like any other multiplayer game.  Season 1 the game wasn't that toxic, season 2 it got more toxic though.  From there, their system of reports and bans and chat bans were introduced and developed and it has resulted in Riot citing "changed behavior success", yes all I see are trolls getting away with being toxic while other players are not allowed to speak in chat in the slightest negative behavior towards them without risking the trolls reporting them.  Yeah, people who get reported are no longer getting reported; but the game is becoming ever more toxic so what is their crappy system really doing for the game?  I've run into more ranked trolls this season than ever before.  People just ping you dead and in-game taunt and stand in your lane etc instead of doing reportable behavior, and meanwhile troll even harder in-game than they used to.  Half my friend group has stopped playing League regularly or altogether because ranked has become increasingly more toxic.  Example, I had a support take nunu (who I was showing as my pick and he took just to piss me off) with smite and follow me around the jungle last hitting my jungle creeps and taunting after each one he stole.  It was all he did for 15 minutes and when I got invaded at blue he taunted and ran away without casting a single spell or doing anything.  I reported him for inting, I'm sure nothing came from that report but I got a chat restriction for bitching at him in chat which started as me pinging him and telling him to go bot after he smited my blue buff.... which I thought was a pretty level-headed response to him stealing my buff in ranked.
Just, like, don't be a dick to people?

so the biggest thing with most people (including me) is typing in chat. For some reason, everything we say comes off as negative, even if we don't intend it to be. That's just how league is. The best chance you have to not getting banned is NOT TYPING ANYTHING AT ALL IN CHAT.

If you have to. just do '/ignore all' as soon as game starts. You won't have any reason to argue back if noone talks to you. The only thing stopping you from not getting banned or flaming chat, is yourself. YOu have to restrain yourself. Something most of us needs working on (including me). And its hard.. but with practice we can do it, for example, you can try to do /note (or /notes?? i forgot) "insert flame here" to let out your stress by typing, but not actually type to team or anyone else. And then you can check the .txt file in riot games folder and see how you were.

tl;dr Don't type. Let it out in real life (don't like smash your stuff or anythihng, i mean like sigh very very deeply and stretch or something, or get some cold water and drink water, that tends to help me alot, staying hydrated.) That's your best bet, if you just don't type, the only way you'll get banned is by scripting/using cheats, or Intentionally feeding. 

OR the occasional suuuuuper rare ban error.
Anger management. People go to therapists for shit like this. I don't think we can help you.

Honestly, easiest way to not be toxic is to internalize that this is just a game. We're not pros. Have your fun, and if somebody else either intentionally or unintentionally ruins your fun for that game, brush it off and have your fun in the next one. League is never worth getting upset over, though I sympathize with the fact that the game's design does cultivate that impulse.
